name: The Five Hotel by Elegancia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We staied 5 days in march 2009. This tiny hotel is located near the metro staion Les Gobelins in the Latin Quarter. We chose a Glimmering Baldaquin Room: very romantic choice but really tiny; there's no space for your luggage and for your bath appareil in the toilet, but there's a very cool led shower. The staff is very kind but 'problem solving' it's another thing. We reccomend this hotel for romantic escape.... but only for slim people with light luggage ;-).
reviews.title: A romantic place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was excellent but the service was outstanding. The desk staff was helpful beyond what I'd normally expect and I'm in the business.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is just ncredible. My fiance took me on a journey to Paris for valentine 's day.
reviews.title: a magical journey

reviews.text: It was magical, romantic ,amazing. It was the most beautiful night in my life. The location is great and the room is just spectacular, with all those lights it, was like we were in a different world, disconnected from reality.
reviews.title: We are disappointed

reviews.text: I really advise couples and lovers to stay there, if you want to surprise your girflend there is no better place.
reviews.title: Wow, je t´aime, The Five

reviews.text: The Five is a nice idea with some issues in implementation. The rooms are tiny and the structure isn't the best. Quiet location, but far from metro main lines.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel on the phone, and it was extremely easy to do so. We booked the suite since we were bringing our two chihuahuas and needed the space. We too knew to expect a smaller than usual room, but even so were still surprised at the size, even with the suite. The bathroom was a great size and the lights and fixtures were beautiful. It was nice to have a separate little seating area with a great flat screen, also very pretty. The bedroom however was so small I actually woke up in the night feeling a little panicky. I also woke up due to very loud and continual banging from the other side of the wall directly beside my head, both nights. I believe it was from the building beside or perhaps behind the front desk. The hot tub and terrace are cute, but totally not private with about 50 windows looking right down on you. The hot tub has a curtain so we still enjoyed it, though not allowed after 9 pm. The door to the room is right in the lobby, a little awkward but convenient to walk the dogs . The best part was the staff!! The girl at the front was SO helpful, made perfect suggestions for restaurants as though she knew us personally. I must suggest Marty's Oyster Bar, absolutely fantastic food and service, and about a 7 minute walk away. The area is totally un-stereotypical Paris, so if you want eiffel tower views you'll be disappointed. We loved it however with great open markets, pubs and cafes, which is needed since there is no room service or bar in the hotel- but good for getting you out to experience Paris!
reviews.title: Stayed in suite, good, not great, but super staff.

reviews.text: Stayed one week in a Standard Room on the 5th floor. Already armed with the knowledge that Paris rooms are small, was still taken aback at the small size of the room when I first opened the room door (was like 2 steps away from the bed!). Nevertheless, the room was clean, very modern touches and well kept.
reviews.title: Enjoyable!
A great place to stay in Paris...
reviews.text: - - - Room Features - - -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were over 300 channels to watch on tv (channels coming from practically all over the world), free internet access and you can open the windows in your room (a good relief because the small room did get warm quickly, esp when u have the hair dryer going and realizing we weren't able to control the thermostat of the room after speaking to the receptionist - though, they did accommodate us by making the floor cooler for us).
reviews.title: Romantic Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Five Hotel was a perfect choice for a weekend in Paris. The room was small but beautifully and unusually decorated, with fairy lights aplenty and a bizarre and brilliant LED shower. Fantastic if - like me - you enjoy flamboyant design! The staff were delightful and had perfect English. The bed was very comfortable and the location is great: very close to the lovely Rue Mouffetard. In short, we'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely and unusual boutique hotel

reviews.text: I am an interior designer myself so looking for an hotel i always try to find something special .I've stayed in many hotels(most of the time with all four if my children so more rooms are required) but the difference between the Five is simple this hotel is created and managed by people who love their job. proberly this concept brings next Five hotel to Champs elysees?
reviews.title: absolute fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What else shall I say than congratulations!!!!!
reviews.title: yes! somehting different

reviews.text: Even if the rooms are small, they are sooo CUTE!!!!!|!|!! and very ROMANTIC!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: a very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked the little lights and the best was the shower... Quite unexpected!! We wont say more, you have to discover it!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back in may, i decide to have a weekend away with my wonderful girlfriend to treat her, so i booked up online for a amazing looking hotel. Looking on the website The Five Hotel had stunning rooms.
reviews.title: Amazing Weekend

reviews.text: When arriving at the hotel we was greeted by a lovely team of girls behind the desk. They were led by a girl called Tanya, who couldn't do enough for us. When telling her it was our first year anniversary, took it on herself to make sure we had an amazing one.
reviews.title: J'adore The Five!

reviews.text: Opening the door of the room and walking in, we was greeted by a bucket of ice and a cold bottle of champagne. Which was lovely to drink after a early start to the day and traveling there.
reviews.title: Great staff, average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was stunning, perfect to be honested, it was very romantic, with a really modern feel. I love anything modern and different to the norm. So for me i was over joyed.
reviews.title: stunning hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast delievered to our room was very good, it was a typically a french breakfast and was very nice. We didn't eat in the hotel again tll the next days breakfast.
reviews.title: overstylized, undersubstanced...

description: Ideally located in one of Paris’s oldest districts, the Five Hotel by Elegancia Hotels is a great base for history buffs wanting to explore the Gallo-Roman Arènes de Lutèce, the Museum of Cluny for medieval artifacts, Notre Dame Cathedral or the Sorbonne, one of Europe’s oldest Universities. Just a few steps away, you will find the rue Mouffetard.Room Concept:As you step across the threshold you'll discover a cocoon, sprinkled with rose petals. In its determination to create a different world, the Five Hotel has used one of the most noble of Asian arts: lacquer. You will recognize the art of Isabel Emmerique in all the rooms of the Five Hotel where she made a unique oeuvre ...elsewhere and differently.Our reception is open 24/7. Our friendly multilingual staff will assist you in every way to help make your stay in Paris a memorable and unique one, do not hesitate to call on them to book a show, a restaurant or a taxi.Services:Luggage room, Laundry service, Lift, Air conditioning, Safety deposit boxes, Breakfast buffet, Breakfast in room, in room massage, beauty treatments on request. Free wireless Internet access is available throughout the hotel.
